title: Running tests with junit is fine, but when running with maven java.net.BindException: Address already in use: bind
body:
### Describe the bug

Hi, I've writed an example project [here](https://github.com/paolopiccinini/quarkus-classnotfound). When I run the unit tests from the IDE one by one everything is fine. But when i try to compile with maven I got an exception:


Also the integration tests are broken if I launch them with the IDE:
`java.lang.IllegalStateException: Unable to locate the artifact metadata file created that must be created by Quarkus in order to run integration tests. Make sure this test is run after the Quarkus artifact is built from your build tool.`
I've added the full stack trace in the integration tests class.

And how @QuarkusMainTest works? It injects a mock of the resource? Because it seems to start the same moked server.

### Expected behavior

No Exception thrown when compiling

### Actual behavior

Exception thrown when compiling

### How to Reproduce?

mvn clean package

### Output of `uname -a` or `ver`

_No response_

### Output of `java -version`

_No response_

_No response_

_No response_

### Build tool (ie. output of `mvnw --version` or `gradlew --version`)

_No response_

### Additional information

_No response_
